intro: Sericocoma angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sericocoma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its narrow, linear leaves are adapted to reduce water loss, and it produces small yellow flowers that attract pollinators. Sericocoma angustifolia is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
